description: Chef Lee is a master of Chinese cuisine, with a particular passion for Sichuan cooking. He loves to experiment with new flavors and ingredients, and is always pushing the boundaries of what is possible in the kitchen.

recipes.name: Mapo tofu
recipes.method: In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add ground pork, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until browned. Add tofu, Sichuan peppercorns, chili oil, and chili bean paste, and stir-fry until the sauce is thick and bubbly. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Kung pao chicken
recipes.method: In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add chicken, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until cooked through. Add Sichuan peppercorns, dried red chilies, and peanuts, and stir-fry until fragrant. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into small cubes

recipes.name: Dan dan noodles
recipes.method: Cook the noodles according to package instructions. In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add ground pork, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until browned. Add chili oil, soy sauce, and vinegar, and stir-fry until well combined. Serve over the cooked noodles.

description: Chef Wang is a culinary artist, specializing in delicate and intricate dishes that are as beautiful to look at as they are delicious to eat. He has a deep understanding of Chinese cooking techniques and ingredients, and he loves to share his knowledge with others.

recipes.name: Shrimp and vegetable dumplings
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine shrimp, water chestnuts, scallions, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch. Place a tablespoon of the filling in the center of a dumpling wrapper and seal the edges. Steam the dumplings for 10-12 minutes until cooked through. Serve hot with dipping sauce.
ingredients: 1/2 lb raw shrimp, peeled and deveined

recipes.name: Stir-fried beef with broccoli
recipes.method: In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add beef and stir-fry until browned. Add garlic and ginger, and stir-fry until fragrant. Add broccoli and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. Add oyster sauce, soy sauce, and water, and stir-fry until the sauce thickens. Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Hot and sour soup
recipes.method: In a pot, combine chicken stock, tofu, bamboo shoots, mushrooms, and vinegar. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add beaten egg and stir until cooked. Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.
ingredients: 1/2 lb soft tofu, cut into small cubes

description: Chef Chen is a culinary master, with a talent for combining traditional Chinese flavors and techniques with modern cooking styles. He is known for his innovative dishes and his passion for using the freshest and highest-quality ingredients.

recipes.name: Peking duck
recipes.method: Clean and dry the duck. Mix together honey, soy sauce, and five-spice powder, and brush the mixture over the duck. Roast the duck in the oven until the skin is crispy and golden. Serve with pancakes, scallions, and hoisin sauce.

recipes.name: Ma la xiang guo
recipes.method: In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add Sichuan peppercorns, dried red chilies, and garlic, and stir-fry until fragrant. Add your choice of meats and vegetables, and stir-fry until cooked through. Season with soy sauce, sugar, and MSG. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 lb meat (beef, chicken, pork, or lamb), thinly sliced
2 cups mixed vegetables (such as mushrooms, bell peppers, and bean sprouts)

recipes.name: Kung pao chicken
recipes.method: In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned. Add Sichuan peppercorns, dried red chilies, and peanuts, and stir-fry until fragrant. Add scallions and garlic, and stir-fry until fragrant. Season with soy sauce, sugar, and vinegar. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into small cubes

description: Chef Liu is a master of Cantonese cuisine, with a focus on fresh and seasonal ingredients. He is known for his delicate flavors and beautiful presentation, and his dishes are a favorite among both locals and visitors.

recipes.name: Cantonese-style steamed fish
recipes.method: Clean and dry the fish. Season with ginger, scallions, and soy sauce. Steam the fish over high heat until cooked through. In a separate pan, heat oil over high heat. Add ginger, scallions, and soy sauce, and stir-fry until fragrant. Pour the mixture over the fish and serve hot.
ingredients: 1 whole fish (such as sea bass or red snapper)

recipes.name: Wonton soup
recipes.method: In a bowl, mix together ground pork, shrimp, scallions, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Place a small spoonful of the mixture in the center of a wonton wrapper, and fold the wrapper to seal. Bring chicken stock to a boil in a pot. Add wontons and cook until they float to the surface. Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.
ingredients: 1/2 lb raw shrimp, peeled and deveined

recipes.name: Char siu pork
recipes.method: Mix together honey, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice wine, and five spice powder in a bowl. Rub the mixture all over the pork, and let marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 375Â°F. Place the pork on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through. Serve hot.
ingredients: 1 lb pork shoulder or tenderloin, cut into long strips

description: Chef Wang is a master of Sichuan cuisine, known for his bold flavors and use of Sichuan peppercorns. He has won numerous awards for his dishes, which are both delicious and visually stunning.

recipes.name: Mapo tofu
recipes.method: In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add ground pork and stir-fry until browned. Add Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until fragrant. Add tofu and stir gently. Add a mixture of chicken stock, soy sauce, and cornstarch, and stir until the sauce thickens. Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 lb soft tofu, cut into small cubes

recipes.name: Dan dan noodles
recipes.method: Cook noodles according to package instructions. In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add ground pork and stir-fry until browned. Add Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until fragrant. Add chili oil, soy sauce, and sesame paste, and stir until well combined. Serve the sauce over the noodles, and top with scallions and peanuts.

recipes.name: Ma la hot pot
recipes.method: In a large pot, bring chicken or beef stock to a boil. Add Sichuan peppercorns, dried red chilies, ginger, garlic, and scallions. Add meat, vegetables, and tofu, and cook until tender. Dip the cooked ingredients in a mixture of sesame oil and soy sauce, and serve with steamed rice.

recipes.method: In a wok, heat oil over high heat. Add ground pork and stir-fry until browned. Add Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until fragrant. Add tofu and stir gently. Serve the sauce over the noodles, and top with scallions and peanuts.
